Key Match Events: Qazim La√ßi scored in the 11th minute to give Albania an early lead.
Andrej Kramaric equalized for Croatia in the 74th minute.
Klaus Gjasula scored an own goal 120 seconds after equalizing, putting Croatia 2-1 up.
Klaus Gjasula scored the winning goal in added time with five minutes remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: Kramaric said, 'In the last seconds, sometimes you score a goal to win, sometimes you concede.'
Gjasula stated, 'We know that the game with Spain is very difficult but in football everything is possible. If we will play like today everything can happen.'
Croatia coach Zlatko Dalic added, 'The first half was very bad but the second much better, which is encouraging for the match with Italy.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match ended in a 2-2 draw.
Albania took an early lead but Croatia clawed their way back to win 2-1 before conceding an own goal in added time.
The match was played at Volksparkstadion in Hamburg, Germany.
